intro: Ooia secta, commonly known as the slender flax, is a herbaceous plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are often borne on long pedicels. Ooia secta is typically found in moist, shady environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
